birds.name: Andaman Woodpecker
birds.description: The Andaman Woodpecker (Dryocopus hodgei) is a species of bird in the woodpecker family Picidae. It is endemic to the Andaman Islands of India.

birds.name: Kashmiri Flycatcher
birds.description: The Kashmiri Flycatcher (Ficedula subrubra) is a small passerine bird in the Old World flycatcher family. It is found mainly in the Kashmir region of India.

birds.name: Swamp Francolin
birds.description: The Swamp Francolin (Francolinus gularis) is a species of francolin found in the swamps and grasslands of the Indian subcontinent, particularly in the northern regions.

birds.name: Yellow-throated Bulbul
birds.description: The Yellow-throated Bulbul (Pycnonotus xantholaemus) is a species of songbird in the bulbul family, found in the scrub forests and rocky hills of southern India.

birds.name: Egyptian Vulture
birds.description: The Egyptian Vulture (Neophron percnopterus) is a small Old World vulture and the only member of the genus Neophron. It is found in southern Europe, Africa, and parts of Asia.

birds.name: Lesser Florican
birds.description: The Lesser Florican (Sypheotides indicus) is a bustard found in tall grasslands of the Indian subcontinent. It is notable for its elaborate courtship displays.

birds.name: Nilgiri Blue Robin
birds.description: The Nilgiri Blue Robin (Sholicola major) is a small passerine bird endemic to the Shola forests of the Western Ghats in southern India. It is also known as the White-bellied Shortwing.

birds.name: Saker Falcon
birds.description: The Saker Falcon (Falco cherrug) is a large bird of prey that breeds from eastern Europe across Asia to western China. It is known for its powerful hunting abilities.

birds.name: Steppe Eagle
birds.description: The Steppe Eagle (Aquila nipalensis) is a bird of prey that inhabits the open country of eastern Europe, Central Asia, and parts of Africa. It is a migratory species, moving to Africa and South Asia in winter.

birds.name: Bengal Florican
birds.description: The Bengal Florican (Houbaropsis bengalensis) is a large terrestrial bird found in the Indian subcontinent, particularly in grasslands and marshes. It is critically endangered due to habitat loss.

birds.name: Sociable Lapwing
birds.description: The Sociable Lapwing (Vanellus gregarius) is a critically endangered wader bird native to central Asia. It is known for its long migrations to the Middle East, India, and Africa.

birds.name: Spoon-billed Sandpiper
birds.description: The Spoon-billed Sandpiper (Calidris pygmaea) is a small wader in the family Scolopacidae. It is critically endangered and known for its distinctive spoon-shaped bill.
